attributes.action: allow the BBFC to continue in their current role without the political interference called for in the British Board of Film Classification (Accountability to Parliament and Appeals) Bill 2007-08
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British Board of Film Classification (Accountability to Parliament and Appeals)Bill seeks to

- make provision for parliamentary scrutiny of senior appointments to the British Board of Film Classification and of guidelines produced by it

- to establish a body with powers to hear appeals against the release of videos and DVDs and the classification of works in prescribed circumstances

At the present time the BBFC is an independent, non-governmental body that classifies films for release in the UK and provides guidance and information for film viewers.

This Bill would herald a step back to an era of censorship where the Government would decide what adults can and cannot watch.

If you believe in freedom of artistic expression and the ability of adults to decide what they watch please sign this petition.
